extendedIngredients.name: shrimp
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound cooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

recipes.title: Shrimp with Orange Pineapple Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santa Cristina by Antinori Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Cristina by Antinori Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: The 2012 wine is deep straw-yellow in color. This classic Pinot Grigio offers intense aromas of tropical fruit and citrus. Soft and flavorful on the palate with flavors of pineapple and pear, this wine has well-balanced acidity and a long finish.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a small saucepan, combine the first five ingredients. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Chill until serving. Serve with shrimp.                                        Yield: about 2-1/2 dozen (2/3 cup sauce).                                                                                                                         Originally published as Shrimp with Orange Pineapple Sauce in  Healthy CookingOctober/November 2009, p53                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 shrimp with 1 teaspoon sauce equals 29 calories, trace fat (trace saturated fat), 22 mg cholesterol, 23 mg sodium, 4 g carbohydrate, trace fiber, 3 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a small saucepan, combine the first five ingredients. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Chill until serving.
